Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2014 05:20AM lichensandseeds wrote: Hi Jacqui! I've been lurking a bit on this site and wasn't planning to post anything, but I figured I would since I've been experiencing a similar situation.  I'm also 27, and a few weeks ago at my physical my doctor found a lump in my left breast that she thought was different from the rest of my breast tissue.  I can feel it too-- it's about 1 cm and feels kind of flat and solid (and different from my surrounding tissue and right breast).  She sent me for an ultrasound which showed nothing, and the tech told me that it was "probably just dense tissue" but that I should follow up with my doc.   When I e-mailed my doctor about whether I should follow up, she wrote to say that she's going put in a referral for me to go to a breast clinic and ask them whether I should have more testing or just watch things.  I know from experience that these referrals usually take a few weeks to go through, but I think I'm okay with waiting because I'm grateful that my doctor is being proactive.   I spent a lot of time stressing during the week that I was waiting for my ultrasound!  I think that the worry has gradually gotten easier to deal with over time because I'm beginning to see that the likelihood of this being serious is small.  I've also been thinking that even if this is something serious, it seems that diagnoses tend to take a long time for many people, so I should just resign myself to the fact that this could take awhile and try not to let it eat at me too much in the meantime.   Anyway, just wanted to say hi since we're the same age and dealing with things that don't show on ultrasound.  I hope the waiting gets easier for you!
Posts.Title: Lump palpable but not visible JacquiW mel147

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2014 04:13PM lichensandseeds wrote: Hi Jacqui, I actually ended up having my appointment today!  It was scheduled unexpectedly quickly.  I did meet with a breast surgeon, and I felt like she was very attentive and thorough in her exam.  She requested another ultrasound and a mammogram which I had at the breast clinic, and then I met briefly with her again.  Both the ultrasound and the mammogram showed dense but normal tissue, and when I met with the surgeon a second time she said that she thinks everything is fine but that her standard protocol for any palpable lump is to do a follow up exam in 3 months.  I'm comfortable with this plan because it seems to me that everyone at the clinic listened to my questions and concerns and did not dismiss me because of my age.  The first time I had an ultrasound, the radiologist didn't even enter the room.  This time, however, I spoke with two radiologists.  One of them told me that dense tissue can sometimes seem more prominent when it is directly over the rib bone, and this is where my lump is.  I appreciated that each radiologist (and the ultrasound tech) took time to describe what they were doing and seeing on the screen.  I think that it was nice to be at a breast clinic because everyone seemed accustomed to working with women who share the concerns we do.   I think it's important to seek information until you feel comfortable with the outcome.  I've also been really grateful for this site!  I've learned a lot from reading about others' experiences.  I hope that the waiting period gets easier for you and that you're able to keep busy-- and that you get answers so that you can move forward!
Posts.Title: Lump palpable but not visible JacquiW mel147
